snippet: Though Hurricane Sandy raged up the East Coast, it has become increasingly apparent that New Jersey took the brunt of it.
abstract: Aftermath of Hurricane Sandy reveals that New Jersey took brunt of monster storm that rampaged up East Coast; hurricane caused catastrophic flooding, destroying entire neighborhoods across the state and wiping out iconic boardwalks in shore towns popular with vacationers; officials estimate damage at worth many billions of dollars; more than two million people remain without power, about half of them in New Jersey, and at least eight people were killed.
lead_paragraph: Though Hurricane Sandy raged up the East Coast, it has become increasingly apparent that New Jersey took the brunt of it.

headline.seo: New Jersey Continues to Cope With Hurricane Sandy
headline.main: New Jersey Reels From Storm’s Thrashing
headline.print_headline: New Jersey Reels From Storm's Thrashing
headline.sub:
Billions in Damage
Seen; 2 Million Are
Still Without Power
